lead_paragraph: An article last Sunday about the effects the Sept. 11 attacks have had on television news and entertainment cited the shortage of reliable firsthand reporting from the Afghan war zone. It said American reporters were ''forced to rely on video from the Defense Department and bits of unverifiable secondhand film sent out by a range of sources: the Taliban, the Arab television channel Al Jazeera, Reuters.'' In fairness, Reuters should not have been grouped with those sources. It is an independent Western news agency.
abstract: Editors' note on November 4 article on effects that September 11 attacks had on television news and entertainment; notes Reuters is independent Western news agency and should not have been grouped with Taliban and Arab TV channel Al Jazeera as unverifiable secondhand news source
